description: Kumail Nanjiani’s Culture-Clash Comedy - The New Yorker
extended: In 2009, on the “Late Show with David Letterman,” the comedian Kumail Nanjiani walked onstage, wearing a boxy black suit and a cordless mike, to do a standup set. The band played a few bars of “Born in the U.S.A.,” an allusion, presumably, to the fact that he wasn’t.

description: Greg Foley’s new book anthologizes punks, flappers, skateboarders, and a century of subversive style and sound. - Vogue
Ferguson Protestor Featured in Iconic Photograph Dies at 27 | BLAVITY
#J20 Inauguration Day Protesters Facing Up to 75 Years in Prison | Democracy Now!
New Alt-Right “Fight Club” Ready for Street Violence | Southern Poverty Law Center
Power struggle between regime, Kurdish Self-Administration plays out in region’s largest public hospital - Syria Direct
extended: AMMAN: In the northeastern reaches of Syria’s Kurdish-controlled territory, a months-long row between local political forces is bringing operations at the area’s largest hospital to a near-total standstill.

description: Prosecutors file additional charges against inauguration protesters - The Washington Post
extended: Prosecutors on Thursday filed additional charges against more than 200 protesters who were arrested during President Trump’s inauguration in January.

As the news industry has grappled with a tectonic shift in how news is consumed in the era of social media, one particularly intriguing trend is the way in which journalists themselves have integrated social content into their reporting.
